SEARCH

Module org.jandle

module org.jandle
The single module of the Jandle HTTP framework.

This module provides a lightweight, modular HTTP server framework built on top of the JDK HttpServer. It exposes a clean public API for handling HTTP requests and responses, middleware-style filter chains, cookies, CORS handling, rate limiting, lifecycle hooks, and structured logging.

Design Goals

  • Minimal dependencies (JDK + Gson)
  • Explicit, stable public API surface

Module Dependencies

  • com.google.gson — JSON serialization and deserialization
  • jdk.httpserver — underlying HTTP server implementation

Exported Packages

  • org.jandle.api — core public API entry points
  • org.jandle.api.annotations — routing and framework annotations
  • org.jandle.api.http — HTTP request/response abstractions
  • org.jandle.api.cookies — cookie handling utilities
  • org.jandle.api.cors — Cross-Origin Resource Sharing support
  • org.jandle.api.ratelimiter — request rate limiting utilities
  • org.jandle.api.lifecycle — application lifecycle hooks
  • org.jandle.api.exceptions — framework-specific exceptions
  • org.jandle.api.logger — internal request and lifecycle logging

Encapsulation

All non-exported packages are considered internal implementation details and are not part of the public API contract.

Consumers of this module should rely only on the exported packages, as internal packages may change without notice.
